snippet: Facing politically damaging charges by other Republican Presidential hopefuls that he is a "big taxer," Gov. Pete Wilson called today for a 15 percent cut in California taxes, with the issue to be decided by a ballot referendum.   "It's time to ta...
lead_paragraph: Facing politically damaging charges by other Republican Presidential hopefuls that he is a "big taxer," Gov. Pete Wilson called today for a 15 percent cut in California taxes, with the issue to be decided by a ballot referendum. "It's time to take our cause to the people," said the Governor, who in his first term supported a major tax increase but since then has been urging the State Legislature, without success, to make tax cuts.

headline.main: Governor Wants to Cut California Taxes by 15%
